user.biography: Independent craft brewery in Portland, Maine. Belgian-inspired beers. Certified B Corp. All things beer, food, and Maine. Must be 21+ to follow.

node.text: This week Zach, our Quality Manager, helps to answer two of your questions: can you age saison and wild beers; and what is the best glassware for a lager beer? Have a beer question of your own? Let us know and we may feature it on Quality Time with Allagash.

node.title: Quality Time with Allagash - Aging saison and lager beer glassware

node.text:
Want to enjoy a perfect glass of Allagash White in the comfort of your own home? Mike is here to show you how to properly "rouse your yeast" for the optimal experience with our favorite witbier.

Have other beer-related questions? Let us know!

node.text: Feel that? Us too. Temperatures in Maine are dropping which means Coolship brewing begins! To help you (and us!) get all geared up for the 2019 Coolship season, check out this incredible video our friend @grassowhat created.

node.text: Truepenny: one both trusty and honest. Also: a crisp and clear pilsner blended with a hint of wild beer. This Belgian-style Pilsner ships to our entire distribution.

node.text: We join Mike at Eventide Oyster Company to tell us a little bit about how to get started with briny bivalves.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Portland, Maine. May be an image of drink.

node.text:
All we touch and all we see is all our lives will ever be. And we were lucky enough to weave our experience together with Kofi Meroe of @sankofabeer for this year’s @barrelandflow.

Our collaboration beer, Woven in Time, is an expressive and balanced dark ale brewed with millet and smoked maple syrup. In Ghana, where Kofi is from, millet is a common ingredient. And to approximate the smoky flavor of many Ghanaian dishes, he and our team used an ingredient found right here in New England: smoked maple syrup.

Tying it all together is the beer’s label, designed by the thoughtful and talented @rachelgloriaia, who’s based right here in Portland. You can find her artwork and murals on display across Maine and beyond.

Find Woven In Time at Barrel & Flow Fest, available on Tavour starting 8/20. Check out @barrelandflow for all the details.

node.text:
For us, summertime means friends, tasty seafood, and an Allagash White (or two). 

📸 @tightloopsfly with @maineflycompany

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Portland, Maine. May be an image of drink.

node.text: What’s your River Trip vibe: 🛶, 🏖, or 🎣

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Corea, Maine. May be an image of coast and nature.

node.text: Heading out to explore Maine’s coast.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Maine. May be an image of nature, tree, body of water and text that says 'FROM MAINE WITH'.

node.text: We’re getting wild. Brettanomyces, a type of wild yeast, is to thank for much of the flavor of this 3.5% ABV, highly drinkable Belgian-style ale. It boasts a crisp and complex profile of pineapple, citrus, stone fruit, and just a hint of funk. Part wild beer, part aromatic amber ale, all balanced and delicious. From Maine, With Love #08 is available now in 4-packs of 16oz cans, only in our tasting room. As always, a portion of the proceeds from all From Maine, With Love beers goes to preserving and protecting Casco Bay in Portland, Maine.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 12, 2021. May be an image of crustacean and indoor.

node.text:
Just your average lunch here in Maine. (J/K, this is an above average lunch.) 

📸: @rikyg_

Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 12, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, crustacean and indoor.
Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 12, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.
Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Medawisla Wilderness Lodge and Cabins. May be an image of tree, nature and sky.

node.text: If you’re in Maine (and it’s nighttime), look up. We're fortunate to have some of the clearest, starriest skies in the country, thanks to organizations like our friends @appalachianmountainclub, whose Maine Woods property was recently granted International Dark Sky Park status for its exceptional quality of starry nights. We'd like to take this moment not only to consider the cosmos, but also to recognize the people who make it possible.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Allagash Brewing Company. May be an image of drink and outdoors.

node.text:
*CONTEST CLOSED* Some might call it a refreshing pale ale with lemon and sea salt. We call it From Maine, With Love 07. A lightly tart and citrusy summertime beer with just a hint of salt, it'll transport you directly to Maine no matter where you happen to be. From Maine, With Love 07 can be found only at the brewery in 4-packs of 16oz cans, with a portion of the proceeds directed toward helping to preserve and protect the waters of Casco Bay.

BONUS: The beautiful image of Maine on this beer’s label could be yours. Just comment with your favorite Maine beach, and we’ll randomly select one comment to receive a limited edition 11x14" print of the photo featured on the From Maine, With Love 07 label.

Winners will be notified by August 19, 2021. No Purchase Necessary. Must be 21+ to enter. US residents only. ⁠Not affiliated with Instagram. Ends August 18, 2021. 1 prize. Approx. value: $25.

node.text: If you’ve ever enjoyed a bottle of Curieux, our bourbon barrel-aged golden ale, you can thank folks like Matthew for making sure it’s consistently delicious, every single time. Our production and quality teams test every single barrel before they’re blended. It’s hard work, but every time we taste Curieux’s balanced notes of vanilla, caramel, oak, and a hint of bourbon, we know it’s worth it.
